intro: Gurania paulista, commonly known as the Brazilian nettle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, which includes other species known for their stinging hairs. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered with fine, irritating hairs that can cause skin irritation upon contact. Gurania paulista produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, contributing to its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
